description:
This is the best Indian restaurant in San Francisco downtown and people are so friendly mainly sabi she was good.

She gave us best service and mainly chicken tikka masala is so delicious.

I prefer to go with family and friends regularly and they have delivery option. 

I will give the best caption for this restaurant serves fast and fresh
author: Rini S.

description:
This is the best place for Indian restaurant and near to market street I follow up every day for different varieties of food in buffet and people are so friendly..

Service was so good and Mainly the woman Ravi the way of receiving and talking was awesome.
author: Tarun N.

description:
This restaurant was such a disappointment!
I guess it's time for them to change their chefs.
The Chole bhature,Pav bhaaji were so bad that I left 70% of the food.
Dahi puri and rose lassi were ok.
The restaurant itself is in a nice location at Union Square and was neat and clean,but the food was not up to  the mark.
author: Ramya R.

description:
Food is okay... biryani is bad...its a pulaav
Buy still 4 star for price and quantity and location
author: Amit A.

description: The food was good (even tho I'm waiting for my favorite Little Delhi to reopen) but the wait staff paid attention to everyone in the place EXCEPT me!! If i was a dishonest person I could've just walked out & no one would of noticed...
author: Toy B.

description:
Food is good, but overpriced. The chaats are amazing. I tried some of the samosa chaat, and it was really good. My friends had some of the others, and they were all praises about it too. I tried the caesar salad too with tandoori chicken. It was okay, but there was WAY too much dressing. It was so drenched in dressing that I spent half the time taking it off the lettuce!
The lunch buffet is not worth the money. Food is just so-so, and doesn't even include any chaat!
author: Haylee M.

description: Chaat Corner is the perfect place for Curry and other Indian fare.  Staff are quick and pleasant.  Will definitely be back.  The Korma is pretty dang good and the naan is ok, too. Bring friends.  Lots of space and it appears there is a chain of chaat across the city. So, I should be sampling all of the establishments.
author: Michael V.

description:
Nasty food, yuck... food tasted old, had a stale smell taste and I had the worst cramps of my life after ordering food from here. We ordered food from here because they were open late, and it was a big mistake. We ordered chicken, chicken biryani and chaat. And I don't know what 

If you care about your health, do not order from here. Won't be coming back.
author: Shanzay H.

description:
We ordered Pav bhaaji and chole bhature,they were absolutely tasteless and bland.
It was a mistake going to this restaurant.
author: Vansh M.

description: I've been going to Chaat corner for a few years now. Their quality went down over the last few years. This year three different people got food poisoning including me on three different occasions. The taste is also consistently bad. There are a million other good Indian restaurants in the city. But if price is a factor then Chaat corner is the cheapest. But you get what you pay for.
author: Sai M.

description:
Came here for an early dinner on Monday. Plenty of seating available. We were able to choose our table. 

Papri Chaat - My friend described this as Indian Nachos... Pretty accurate if you ask me. Very refreshing and delicious! I love the yogurt and tamarind flavors together. Don't let this sit too long, the chips will get soggy! Will order this again!

Veggie Pakora - Yum! Fried veggies, what's not to like?! 

Chicken Tikka Masala Dinner - Super flavorful and savory! Comes with basmati rice , veggie of the day and dal. Upgraded my Naan to garlic naan. Everything was super tasty and I had enough leftovers for lunch the next day. 

Strawberry Lassi - Had a bit of the artificial strawberry flavor, but still good. 

The staff left us alone. We chatted and ate for what seemed like quite a while! There weren't a lot of people dining so we took our time. Overall, I think the value for the meal was great. The cherry on top was discovering that Chaat Corner is enrolled in the Yelp cash back program. 

Great option for lunch or dinner!
author: Dorothy L.

description: Amazing Ambiance & food. Conveniently located in Union Square. Great late night spot to grab a meal after a day of shopping.
author: Liza S.

description:
Jamie W. and I have been to the other Chaat Corner on 3rd Street many times. Many, many times usually close to midnight since it's one of the few Indian spots open that late. We actually thought the food was middling except for their piping hot garlic naan and a questionably indigenous dish, tandoori chicken pizza. Looking for a quick dinner near Union Square, we came upon this tourist magnet of a restaurant on Cyril Magnin Street. The overabundance of staff and robust menu looked familiar from the other location, and our choices in return were quite predictable. Of course I ordered the $11.99 Tandoori Chicken Legs, and a succulent pair arrived sizzling on a hot iron plate over a bed of surprisingly raw white onions (photo: http://bit.ly/2EjaDdx).

The poultry was oddly dried out for dark meat. Jamie went for a safer bet, the $12.99 Chicken Tikka Masala, a somewhat watery curry plate with tandoori chicken breast, house spices, tomatoes, onions, cream, and fenugreek (photo: http://bit.ly/2nHlnbe). Although it was reasonably flavorful, it required a lot of jasmine rice to sop it all up. To offset the protein, we shared the $11.99 Okra Vegetable which they refuse to call bhindi masala even though that's what it was (photo: http://bit.ly/2FK6jBc). Swimming in onions, tomatoes, and garlic, it was unfortunately a sloppy mess with the chopped okra mushy. I kept wondering how long the staff kept it in the pot before serving it to unsuspecting customers like us. This Chaat Corner didn't elevate my opinion of their one-size-fits-all operation.

FOOD - 3 stars...predictably middling Indian food didn't delight our taste buds
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...big space but it still felt crowded in here
SERVICE - 3 stars...on the iffy side
TOTAL - 3 stars...this Chaat Corner didn't turn a corner for me
author: Ed U.

description: I had a craving for Indian food but didn't want the standard lunch buffet. Snacky Indian street foods seemed to be the perfect choice. I ordered too much not realizing the size of each dish - samosa Chaat and pav bhaji. The samosa chaat was the perfect blend of da or and spicy - hit the spot. The bhaji was too liquidy/oily and a bit bland. Luckily, I was full from the samosa chaat and didn't really want to eat more.
author: Ajay P.

description:
Horrible! On a Friday afternoon in the city, had to wait 10 mins to be seated in a rather empty restaurant!!!! The server didn't look us in the for the next 20 mins after we were ready with our order. I went up to the desk to place my order. Got up to take my own plates because the servers were tooooo slow. Cherry on top my mom found the back of a earring in her food!!! Disgusting!!!! 
Never going there again
author: Sarwat Z.

description:
The food here is pretty good, but the service is a bit lacking. The servers are distant and barely speak with you when handing you the menu, taking the order, and serving the food. The server even had a slightly annoyed face while serving us our food.

I would recommend the samosa chaat. I have never had this before and am pleasantly surprised at how wonderful it tastes. I'd order this over samosas any day. The amount of sauces in this dish is splendid. I enjoy my sauces and this dish does the trick. It is very saucy, yet refreshing at the same time.

My party also ordered a chicken dish and lamb dish. These two come with curry, naan, basmati rice, and cucumbers. I felt they gave too much starch compared to the meat. The meat comes out on a bed of sliced onions, all settled atop a cast iron platter. This ensure the meat is still sizzling hot and cooking at your table.

The meat would have been good if only it wasn't burnt. We saw other tables order the same type of dishes and their meat was fine. When we received ours, it was burning so badly that a thick cloud of smoke began to swallow up our table and the area surrounding it. It made me cough and choke. Other guests were visibly distraught over the smoke as well. The servers near the area also seemed to have a hard time breathing due to the smoke, but none of them made an attempt to open the doors or do something about it.
author: Jasmine P.

description: We tried their lunch buffet and dinner. The lunch buffet was almost $15 but it doesn't worth. In the dinner we ordered kadhai chicken, Dal fry and roti and glass of red wine. Kadhai chicken was flavorless, roti was not cooked and the wine looks it was opened a long time before. So I want to forget chaat Corner but their staff a girl who served the food was attentive.
author: Fanindra D.

description:
The place was clean, serveurs were nice. Lots of Indians eating there. 
We got the grilled plater: fish, chicken, shrimp and lamb kebab with naan, and the chicken biryani rice with curry sauce and raita, and papadoom. Everything was spicy and good. A lot of food. Recommande.
author: Nataly P.

description:
Thoughts on Chaat Corner:
-Good service, good prices, great hours (they are open until midnight)
-Had the goat Roganjosh (the main dish, naan, dal, and potatoes all were for 18 bucks) and the seekh kabab wrap which were both pretty good. I enjoyed it and especially the curry base with the goat entree. The food was spicy (which I like) but watch out for this if you like your food mild
-Overall Chaat Corner is solid for late night and a nice takeout option
author: Shawn K.

description: Ordered a tikka masala wrap and tea. Perfect lunch with a lot of meat. The spicy flavors are well balanced and not overpowering. The space is a nice retreat from the chaos of market st.
author: Monica L.

description:
I had ordered sev puri, gobi paratha and lassi.

It took 20 mins to serve sec puri, which should a quick appetizer especially they just mixed up premade stuff. Drink lassi should have arrived first, but it came out after a few min


Sev puri: very mediocre. No fresh chatni. Looked like opened up from a packaged food

Rose lassi: it arrived after appetizer, but main issue was it was warm. Very warm. Lassi supposed to be a cold drink. Also too much sugar and very thin.

Gobi partha: packed foe to go, so dont know yet.
author: Patrick P.

description: Pakoras. Butter chicken. Hot Chai or mango lassi, or both. Saag, aloo Gobi, biryani. Tandoori chicken. It all makes my mouth water and I want it.
author: Marin C.

description:
My friends and I stopped by here for lunch for Saturday, and there weren't too many people in the restaurant so we got a table and were served promptly. The waitress was friendly, and they can only take 8 credit cards at a time.

The food was just okay though. The butter chicken was rather salty, and so was the chicken tikka masala, which was a disappointment since those tend to be the more mild dishes. The paneer and one of the goat curries was good though, which is surprising that the curries can vary so much in saltiness, despite both being robust in flavor.

The garlic naan was pretty good too, there was a nice amount of flavor and the bread was soft and chewy. Also the Samosa Chaat was excellent! Great mix of flavors, and a good touch of sweet and sour.

This would be rated higher had the curries been a bit better, since I liked their street foods and their naan, but unfortunately the curries were too hit or miss for me.
author: Tyler T.

description: I am not native to SF so any time I get a chance to come here I loveee to try new places. Especially Indian/Pakistani cusine. One dish that I was so excited to try was Sev Puri and a friend of my mine recommend stopping by here. To be honest it was a bit of a let down I don't much about Indian cuisine but these just didn't seem like what I thought. It was a bit more like Indian nachos.Would go back for the atmosphere food was alright.
author: Moath I.

description:
I went at lunch so I can't comment on their dinner service.  For lunch, my experience was pretty good, and the food was definitely good, but it all was overpriced for the selection offered.  I was kinda shocked by the almost $18 sticker price, which wasn't really advertised anywhere ahead of time.  For that price the food options should have been almost double, plus maybe a few more desserts and salads.  What it was was good, just wouldn't redo that decision knowing what I know now.  Also, the naan was super bland.  Driest I've ever had.

Fyi, the buffet included rice, fried vegetables, biryani (like fried rice), goat curry, chicken tikka masala, daal, a vegetable curry mixture, and saag.  Even just one or two more options would have really made me feel like I got my money's worth.
author: Austin R.

description:
Food: Awesome
Staff: Awesome 
Prices: Meh
Packaging: Failure

I ordered the chili chicken here on Allset (after hunting a bit to find it), and it is a REALLY interesting experience because it tastes nothing like any Chili Chicken I've had before. Normally Chili Chicken has this particular kind of sauce, and it's not heavy on veggies, and it's quite spicy...

This one was quite the opposite. Blossoming with onions and peppers and a wide variety of spices, it was far from the (albeit delicious) sledgehammer of single-purpose flavor that chili chicken usually is.

The one downside is that it nearly got all over my clothes. They packaged it in one of those boxes that doesn't seal, which is a TERRIBLE idea for any sauce-heavy food. The second someone walks down the street with it, or goes around a hard corner in their car, it gets all over. Luckily they included plenty of napkins, because they were all ruined by the time I got home.

The waitresses and waiters were super friendly and speedy, which I suppose isn't too hard at an off hour (I came by in late afternoon), but still nice to see.

Prices are kinda expensive, so I don't know if I'll head down here that often - but their presence on allset is a nice bonus.
author: Chris S.

description: Shout to Reshma for being an amazing server. Food was better than other indian restaurants we tried around union square area. They serve buffet during lunch hour but we chose to.order from a la carte menu. We ordered panner pakora, chole bhaturey, pav bhaji, chai. Of this, pav bhaji was the best. Good service, clean establishment. Worth a visit if craving indian food.
author: Ruchi M.

description: Food tasted old and chewy and wasn't really that good. I have had much better. Our service wasn't that great either - felt uncomfortable, attacked and unwelcomed. Overall not a good experience!
author: Navdeep S.

description:
This place is big and looks very upscale. However the prices are very reasonable. 

They have delicious appetizers but the main course are very bland. We ordered papri Chaat, fish pakoras, and fries for appetizers. They were all very delicious!! Nothing was overly spicy which is the case with most Indian restaurants. 

For main course we ordered chicken korma and goat curry. Their dinner options come with naan, rice, daal, and aaloo matar so you do get a lot of food. The chicken korma tasted exactly like butter chicken and did not have much taste to it. The goat curry was a little better but was still bland. 

Customer service was ok they did not interact much. I would recommend you to come here just for their appetizers then go elsewhere for main course. Also, the sauf (fennel candy) by the door is delicious!
author: Rubab M.

description:
I came to this corner Indian restaurant for a going away party. I had no idea what to order so I had my friends order for me. 
We shared appetizers and they were all vegetarian with dicks. They were delicious, small, but the portions were enough to share.

I got this eggplant dish with garlic naan instead of rice. It was delicious and definitely worth switching out the rice for the naan. My company got the yogurt dessert and it was mango-flavored and grows flavored. Unfortunately they did not like the roast flavored but them go one was delicious.

Not only was the dish really big and I had enough to take to go, the curry dips that came with it got tastier over night. I specifically asked for it to be spicier than the standard because I enjoy spices. And so when you leave Curry overnight the spices develop even more. 

This is a place I would definitely return to the prices were decent they were not expensive at all and they were a lot of seafood and vegan choices as well as vegetarian.

If anyone has any questions or concerns about this place please feel free to contact me. I'll be happy to answer anything that comes my way.
author: Jeremy Y.

description:
My coworker was craving Indian food and he really likes this place so we ended up here for lunch. I can be picky with Indian food but I liked this place and would come again.

Food: we ordered the tandoori chicken plate which came with chicken, rice, daal, cucumber salad and naan. The naan was really good/chewy, the chicken was ok (could've had a bit more flavor), but the daal was the best. It's kind of like daal with butter chicken sauce so I really enjoyed it. 

Service: our server was fast and polite
author: Mira B.

description: Worst place ever. The food was tasteless and not even well cooked. The staff was very rude and uninterested. Their lassi was terrible and tasted like it was made out of some really old yogurt and fruits. When we asked the waiter about it, they just said that this is how it is and they cannot do anything about it. Chhole were severely undercooked. Such a disappointment. Never going there ever again!
author: Khushboo B.

description:
Even though we came here on a Thursday night, 30 minutes before their closing time, they were very friendly and welcoming. 

The menu selection was huge but we finally decided on ordering a Tandori Chicken Wrap and a Chicken Tikka Plate, which came with rice, garlic naan, and curry sauce. The wrap was a good size and it had a good grilled flavor. The Chicken Tikka was good but a bit dry. The curry sauce really helped. However, the meal as a whole was great with a variety of items. 

We both enjoyed our meal a lot. However, the area can be a bit shady at night so beware. In any case, we will be back for more tasty food for sure!
author: Alice L.

description:
Great value and conveniently located in downtown San Francisco. Friendly staff and incredibly reasonable prices give Chaat a well served four star review.

We ordered family style: garlic naan, batura, chicken tikka masala, mini samosas, butter chicken, and chicken biryanis. They were all really good. Strongly recommend.
author: Steve S.

description: Ordered through ubereats. Pakora looked burnt but was perfectly cooked and delicious. The biryani was amazing, with tons of deliciously caramelized onions. The vindaloo was well seasoned with melt-in-your-mouth potato, I just wish there were more pieces of potato. Definitely delicious and definitely will try things.
author: Sunia C.

description:
Horrible service. The waiter was irritated and impatient. We wanted to stop by for gol gappe, fish pakore and gulab jamun. We ordered one of each just to see if we would like it and then could order more later. 

Restaurant is polished, modern, and the food is presented in unique stylish dishware. Bathrooms are clean and modern. 

Food itself did not taste authentic. It was bland. 
The gol gappe stuffing was mostly garbanzo beans and the liquid gol gappe water mixture was salty...not really tasting how authentic gol gappe water is supposed to taste. 

Fish pakore were soggy. We were just sad when we ate these because the chutney they came with was so watery that it did not stick to the pakore. We dunked the pakore in the chutneys and the sauce pretty much slid right off the pakore. It had no substance to it. Bland and watery. 

Gulab jamuns were warmed up upon request and tasted mediocre. 

We didn't order anything more. Were excited to leave as soon as we could. Never coming back. Specially not to deal with the rude waiter who was such a party pooper to an otherwise pleasant atmosphere.
author: Bobbie C.

description:
This has probably been my go to place since I moved to San Francisco. But little did I know that this would become the most unpleasant place. Each time I had gone here, I had experience of either food being extremely cold or the management is extremely rude or there's HAIR IN THE FOOD! - This was in the lunch buffet that they offer. They either come up with explanations of they being helpless about hair being there rather than being polite and apologetic. 
Extremely bad! Has gotten worst over the last few months. Would never visit this place again!
author: Deepti K.

description: Best chaat I've had in SF! Dahi Batata Puri, Papri Chaat, and Pav Bhaji were all excellent.
author: Ankit S.

description: Best Indian Food i had in a Long Time! Online Order and Pick Up is fast and uncomplicated.
author: Carolin C.

description: This place was ok, I've had better Indian food in he city. The latcha paratha was a little too hard kind of like it was taken out from the freezer. My friend ordered chola batura which was not bad. The service here was also not very good. I asked the waiter for a refill of water and he never showed up with the water and instead. bought us our check.
author: Deki T.

description:
Food: I ordered chole bhature. The bhature were flat and reeked of oil. I used 5 napkins to absorb oil and they were completely soaked.

Service: They seemed understaffed. The service was so slooooow.

Ambience: The seating is nice. The bathroom was filthy and had no toilet paper.
author: Sneha A.

description: 15.99 daily lunch buffet option that was pretty good. I went on a Saturday. They had two types of chicken Tikka BBQ, a chicken Tikka masala, a paneer Tikka masala, a chickpea saag, goat Curry, a daal curry, okra onion curry, a vegetable curry, biryani rice, and white basmati rice. Buffet also came with naan, Gulab jamun dessert, cucumber/beets, and mint/mango chutney. Chai is extra 2.25. service was great, atmosphere was great, food was a bit salty. Would come again.
author: Hezb H.

description:
Exceptional, friendly, helpful staff. They were kind in plugging my mobile for charging.
Restaurant ambiance is modern, tastefully decorated, well lighted and -  most of all clean.
However the food is very bland and lacks any authenticity to it. Paapri chaat was drowned in yogurt and chutney - needs bhalle  Cholle without required spices. Vada paao potato was plain boiled with mint chutney for flavor and bun was greasy.
Not likely to return.
author: S R.

description: I usually prefer Asian food over Indian food but I had to compromise today cause our aunt liked Indian food so we stumbled upon this place and I'm glad I did. We could choose our own table. Service was fast and friendly. But most importantly the food was delicious. We had the chicken tikka masala with butter Naan,shrimp biryani and samosa chaat. Also, the masala chai tea is bomb. Good food,good music and great customer service. What more do I have to say?
author: Shinobi M.

description: Loved the wada paav .. rest food was average .. gud service and moderatly priced .. gud for snack items ..
author: Aryan S.

description:
Service was almost comically bad. We had to flag down waiters for everything from napkins and silverware, to water refills, where's the drinks we ordered? Can we get the bill? Food was served cold. Cold Indian food is not great. Would not recommend 
.
author: Robert S.

description: The food would have been good if it wasn't cold. The service tonight was awful. I had the chicken tikka masala. The others also had chicken tikka and chicken butter entree. All the food came out cold including the naan, rice, and the vegetables. The waitress forgot the wine and never came to ask about the food or to even refill the water. We had to resort to waving waiters down for everything we needed including the bill. They never cleared the table. The chicken itself was not bad which is the only reason I didn't give it a lower rating. Also, the bathroom was filthy with urine on the floor and garbage overflowing from the waste basket.
author: Michael L.

description:
Here in San Francisco walking around here like always love it and found this great place to get out of the rain and found this place by chance  ....so 
 my girl and I  decided to try the goat curry roganjosh and lentils soup dal tadka.... OMG the flat bread I could have ate 300 of them so good  It was an unexpected treat.....ok I'm done can't move  time to walk and so much food  had to take some to go....great relaxing music  while enjoying out lunch with a great view of the city
author: Felipe A.

description:
Definitely add this place as another great Indian restaurant to the downtown area. 

It's a bit fancier than some of the others located in the vicinity, but the menu reflects this: there's a huge selection to choose from, ranging all over from street food, to appetizers to salads to entrees and desserts. Many of the dishes are available in vegetarian or even vegan version (with tofu instead of paneer), something you rarely see. 

The restaurant wasn't busy when we came in slightly after lunch hour on a Saturday so service was quick and our food came out fast. Portions were well-sized and we weren't disappointed in the quality of our food. We ordered the butter paneer, chicken tikka plate, and a side of rice and garlic naan. Everything was delicious and worth coming here for.
author: Cassandra J.

description: Where do I begin, the food was delicious and the service was fast and friendly! Ordered a Papdi chaat, pav bhaji, and grilled salmon; everything was so good and fulfilling! In the chaat, I could taste all the different flavors, and not a single flavor was talking over the entire dish, it was a perfect balance of flavors!! The strawberry lassi was the highlight because it wasn't sour at all, I could taste the fresh strawberry's in it!! Even the faluda ice cream was outstanding! So much flavor in each dish; overall I had an excellent experience and would definitely recommend this place
author: Simar K.

description:
Chaat Corner is a large and convenient restaurant to get casual Indian foods.

As the name implies, the place has a good selection of chaats, or smaller Indian snacks/appetizers. Despite their selection though, I wasn't exactly impressed by the chaats I ordered. I felt that they were really watered down and didn't have a distinctive flavor. It was kinda this and kinda creamy and kinda spicy. As one of my friends once told me, Indian food is so strong because the right flavor combination gives one strong flavor outing.

As for their curry, it's just alright. There's no flavor that pops out at you or lingers in your mouth making you want more. It's really watery tbh and just not all that savory. Meat is stewed alright though and some Indian flavor elements are there. 

Naans and rotis are alright, although I thought the garlic naan was overpriced and also a bit soggy. The roti is a bit dry but with the sauce it's alright.

Overall, it's a really convenient place but the flavors are underwhelming.
author: Michael Y.

description: I had a good experience at Chaat corner. I ate Thali which was good in quantity and quality. Came with a piece of Gulab Jamoon. Paratha was good in taste. Raita was salty. Overall good food quality and speedy service. I'd go again.
author: Maulik S.

description:
I came to Chaat Corner for dinner after bouncing around Union Square. When you walk in, you notice that the place has a nice ambience and a lighted bar (note that they sell wine and beer, but not cocktails).

I ordered the two-piece samosas (veggie), lamb tikka masala, butter naan (clearly) and a glass of the Indian white wine. The samosas came with daal along the plate, which was too gingery for my taste, but the samosas were good. The lamb tikka came out SO quickly. It was reasonably flavorful and definitely hot, although about half of the lamb chunks were severely overcooked to the point of being difficult to cut. I really enjoyed the wine and was glad to experience a while from a new region. 

There weren't many people in the restaurant on this particular Monday night, so it was quiet. The service was good, too. And everything was super duper affordable!
author: Willie R.

description: Nothing is standoutish here. Their chicken tikka masala is average to below average. Their naan is pretty bad, small and dry. My wife had vegetable curry, all the vegetables we mushy and were clearly frozen and refrozen many times before. Nothing fresh is served here. Service slow. I will not be coming again.
author: Ali O.

description:
Amazing and authentic Indian cuisine in a casual, clean, and inexpensive restaurant close to union square. If you like Indian cuisine from the north and south, you must come and have a meal here. We had garlic naan, lamb tikka masala, chicken tikka masala, and amazing gobi Manchurian. It's not on the menu so ask.
Really a gem!!!!!
author: Michael K.

description: Great meal and knowledgeable wait staff. The restaurant was busy around 7 PM. Probably the best quality and price Indian food you will get in San Francisco city. Was about 45 dollars and 3 adults were stuffed and were able to enjoy an imported Kingfischer beer as well. Family dinner option was great offering 2 appetizers and 3 entrees.
author: Akshay R.

description:
The tandoori shrimp plate was served sizzling hot and tasted very good. The serving size was a large portion and the garlic naan was a nice compliment.

The restaurant was not busy on Sunday night and the service was prompt and attentive. I am not a guru of Indian or Pakistani food but everything sure tasted good to me.

Beer and wine is offered on the menu.
author: Stephen Y.

description:
Service sucks A**!!!!! 
Food is pretty darn good but sadly, usually comes lukewarm, after a really long wait, brought to you by a staff with seriously bad attitude, on a table that is curry splattered and sticky. They tried to stick us with the wrong dessert (rasgulla) then when we asked for it to be corrected, they tried to convince us that is was actually what we ordered (rasmalai). Are you for real? The check itself took so long to come to the table, we had to go up to the counter to find a way to pay, just so we could go home. 
Do yourself a favor and order the food to be delivered. Save yourself the pain called "service" that they bestow upon their patrons at this joint.
author: Gia P.

description:
When i eat Indian/Pakistani I like to go veggie. I ordered two curries but most options lacked protein options. There was one garbanzo bean curry and one lentil.  The service was quick however my naan wasn't soft and chewy, it was crusty.  

The pricing was reasonable but I'll likely try another restaurant when in the mood for Indian and in the area.
author: Jordan M.

description: I really loved lamb curry. It was just great and the waiters were very friendly. I just wish lamb curry could be more
author: Michael M.

description: Best Chicken Tikka Masala I've had since I moved here in 2017 also better than the one I'm used to from the UK. Amazing food and everyone is so friendly! Definitely going back!
author: Svenja P.

description:
Great dinning atmosphere, attractive bar, wonderful  customer service, AMAZING food. 
I had the goat curry and my friend the goat biryani, very big portions, cooked just right and well presented we were both satisfied.
author: Chris P.

description:
My party of 8 enjoyed our dinner.

Menu items pleased everyone's taste buds. 
Host and server were friendly and accommodating. Food arrived fast.

 I ordered the chicken biryani but wanted it very mild (white people mild). Server made sure to get my request across the kitchen staff and out came a delicious dish that didn't burn my tongue! On the menu, it states it came with dark meat. It actually came with white meat. 

Excellent butter chicken, chai tea was strong and not watered down, naan was unimpressive, however, wraps and veggie korma were given thumbs up across the table. 

We will absolutely recommend this place and even return if we're in SF area again.
author: Pam P.

description: Love this place, try thei Hakka Sakka, it is dangerously addictive.   Chai is good and many dishes to choose from
author: Kit M.

description:
great late night spot! (+1 star) indian food after a night of drinking.. can't get much better than that. 

only tried the garlic naan, saag paneer & chicken tika so my review will be based off that. i thought both dishes were good but the portions were fairly small for family style (compared to other indian restaurants i've been to). 

service was alright. not excellent but not horrible. 

parking is a hassle which is to be expected (right in downtown)

will come back again if i go out in the downtown area & need some drunchies.
author: Lauren E.

description: This got 2 stars only because the food was good, the stuff that got to our table at least.  The service was really bad.  Actually they were nice enough, but it was soooo slow.   the bathrooms were disgusting.  They clearly didn't have enough staff to serve the tables properly or clean the bathroom.  It was sticky and smelly from the hallway to the bathroom.  The mini samosas were ON POINT! Delicious!  But, The garlic naan was NOT soft and hot like its supposed to be.   they didn't bring a dish we ordered to us, even after asking 2 times, and it took asking 3 times to get our laasi.  So since the food is delicious, I suggest maybe ordering to go, but make sure you check your order before you leave.
author: P J.

description: I came here with a large group when I was out in SF and we had a great time! One of my friends ordered a bunch of food for the table and everything was delicious! Some of my favorites were the samosa chaat, butter chicken, and chicken tikka masala. The staff was really friendly and shockingly the price was very affordable for the amount of food we ate and the location in San Francisco! Check them out!
author: Tom F.

description: This was so amazing we came back again the next night! I woke up craving their butter chicken! The services was so nice and remembered us. Has a great family feel. Very clean. I come to San Fransisco a lot and I will definitely be back for more. My husband got he tiki masala and loved it.
author: Laura C.

description: The food was average but the service was horrible. Had to ask for chutney with my simosas, waited for my check forever and never got checked on. Never a smile or hello or anything.
author: Amanda D.

description:
Saag lamb was terrible.daal was literally tasteless , just biryani was satisfactory. I think biryani can be cooked by anyone. Thank you chaat corner for wasting my money and ruining my first ever lunch with my family in SF.

Will not visit again
author: Tanzeela Z.

description: Buffet lunch was sub par. Few items and taste was just ok. Sweet felt canned. Chicken tandoori was cold. Chicken and paneer were hard, gravy was ok. Naan was hot but no butter or garlic option. Service was poor. Will not come again
author: Thyaga V.

description: Food, service, restaurant was all very good. We had chaat, chicken tikka, lassi, and biryani. Next time we are in town, we will definitely visit again!
author: Sarah D.

description:
Been here many times. 
great selection of chaats and appetizers. Man to go and cheap options to chose from.
However once the pav bhaji was a lil stinky- had a tinch on smell like it was old. Also the rolls should be made with a thinner bread that makes it easy to eat. They use the naan bread that makes it super inconvinient to eat and everything keeps falling out.
author: Madhura J.

description:
Arrived in San Fran late in the evening. Luckily for us Chaat Corner was open. We enjoyed a delicious Indian dinner of tandoori chicken, garlic naan and other vegetarian dishes.   Food was fresh and tasty. Staff friendly and helpful. Price very good on the pocket book. 

Check out Chaat Corner for a fast and delicious meal in San Francisco.
author: Geoff P.

description: This is one of the best spots in San Francisco to get great Indian/Pakistani food.
author: Fateh S.

description: Their infamous Laccha Paratha. Straight out of the freezer. They look nothing like Parathas. They refused to exchange the order when we asked for Naan instead and they fought until they ruined our meal. These people have no idea what service means and the food tastes exactly how it looks. Miserable, stay away!
author: Jin H.

description: I can only comment on the namesake chaat, which was very good. I had the Sev Puri, Pani Puri, and samosas and while it was a lot of food, it was just the kind of sweet chaat food coma I was craving. Finding good chaat is so damn difficult, so it was a real pleasure to get some downtown while I was in SF for a conference.
author: Shyam S.

description: Food is ok but long waiting lines at the lunch time.
author: Qasim Z.

description:
I can't judge the food but the service is non existent . 

The first time I went I asked for a glass of water 6 times. And forget the waiter coming to our table. We sat there for 15 minutes and no service. No menus no water mo nothing .

Second time i went me and a few friends went to the bar. The restaurant had one other couple  I asked the lady for a menu. Got  it. 20 minutes later still no one to take our order. We tried to get the waiters attention .  Was next to impossible. 

Sorry with an empty restaurant  st 830 pm it shouldn't be too much to serve 2 tables water
author: Indervir G.

description: The waiter was extremely rude. He pointed at a table so we sat down. No menus or water, we had to ask after sitting for 10 minutes! We then tried to order and the waiter seemed to be determined to be unhelpful. He sniggered at us repeatedly and was very resistant to any questions we asked. We walked out in the end, that level of customer service is terrible! I hope the restaurant identifies this person and removes them!
author: Emily G.

description:
This is some of the most delicious food I've eaten outside of my country Jamaica.
This I recommend to those who come to city of Frisco.
author: Patrick M.

description: This place has great value. The dinner plates come with rice, naan, daily vegetable and soup. I got the chicken tikka masala and we shared the aloo tiki app. They were these potato parties with some sauces and chickpeas. They were delish!
author: Katlyn H.

description: Chaat is good but Biryani is worst. Avoid this place if you're a biryani lover. Visit this place if we want to eat something like pakora or any evening snacks (indian style)
author: Sravan N.

description: The service was ok but the food was not so good. I ordered the veg thali. The order never even came in a thali. Presentation was awful. They just dumped the food on a plate and brought it out. The naan was hard and dry. The rice was dry as well. The cucumber chutney was just cucumber cut up with no salt no seasonings no nothing. The dal soup was ok. It just tasted like it was warmed up in a microwave. Both the mens and womens restrooms were out of order. What kind of a restaurant doesn't maintain its restroom? Where are the staff using the restrooms? Are they washing their hands? I have serious doubts about this place. Zero stars at best, Yucks!!
author: Ronald S.

description:
Chaat Corner was the first stop on my journey through SF with my boyfriend. We were STARVING after our crazy flight over, so we decided to explore the neighborhood surrounding our AirBNB in search of food. Lots of other spots were either closed, busy, or a little too seedy, but luckily, we stumbled upon this place. Eye-catching store front, clean interior. I had a good feeling about it.

As we walked in, we were greeted by a friendly woman and were prompted to pick a seat anywhere we'd like. It was pretty quiet inside, despite it being the beginning of dinnertime. The menus we were given were HUGE, full of options for everyone, including vegan & vegetarian, which is always a plus. The food was very good and portions were plentiful. Unfortunately, the service was not. We felt rushed at first, but then were virtually ignored the rest of our meal. At the end, they even mixed up our meal with someone else's and had us each pay the wrong bill, only to scramble to correct it. Had to knock some stars off for that...
author: Lauren R.

description: We stumbled upon this place after late night drinks. We were both a bit apprehensive simply due to the fact that we aren't well versed in this type of food, but WOW! We were both bowled over by our selections, with a little help from our waiter. The Papri Chaat was AMAZING. Like Indian nachos but with yogurt. We said "yum" about 100 times, lol. The garlic naan with curry sauce was excellent and the Keema Pav (Indian sloppy Joe's) were great too. A little too spicy for me but my boyfriend loved them. This was one of those "so glad we went off the beaten path and tried something new" experiences! Would come back in a heartbeat. Missing a star because it was just silent--where was the music?! And a little more low-light/candles would've been nice
author: Brittany R.

description: Fairly large place with nice food. Just ordered some standard takeaway grub and wasn't disappointed. Dining area looked large and even had a few beers on tap if your into that kind of thing.
author: Eddie S.

description: The food tastes amazing, and the staff are helpful. Also a great location for people watching
author: Lindsey D.

description: Excellent FOOD, Great service, I went there last night with couple of my friends, and the experience was amazing, we really enjoyed everything we had. Paneer Tikka Masala favor full and delicious, Daal (lentils) was soft, and Spicy goes perfect with white rice and some naan, Dahi Batata puri was yummy. I would highly recommend this place, and will definitely go back.
author: Nidhi T.

description:
Having walked by this place many times on our way home, we finally decided to give it a chaat. (haha.... er...)

It was perilously empty for a Friday night 7:30 pm. There were actually more staff than diners.. which is never a good sign.

We opted for the Pav Bhaji, Bhel Puri, and Chicken Pakora. 

The Pav Bhaji came out first and was pretty much the saving grace to the whole meal. The  curry was steaming hot as was the freshly toasted buns. Portion size was pretty large for the price. It was also pretty good as Pav Bhaji goes.. the freshly chopped purple onion provided a nice counterbalance to the slightly spicy curry.

Now for the rest of the train wreck.

The Bhel Puri had obviously been sitting around for awhile because the rice puffs were soggy and chewy. I could also barely taste any tamarind or mint in the whole thing. No sign of cilantro anywhere either. We had a couple bites of this and left it there for the trash.

The Chicken Pakora was also obviously some dish they made many hours ago. It came out room temperature and the chicken was the driest chicken jerky I've had in awhile. I had to eat it with the Pav Bhaji to re-moisturize the chicken.

Just to add a rotten cherry on top - the Rose Lassi tasted like Pepto Bismol swirled with my granny's perfume.
author: Henry W.

description: I love this place.  Simpler is better and the Kadhi Chicken, Tikki Masal, garlic naan and all the sides are great.  My go to when I'm in town and need a quick bite.
author: Jack H.

description:
This is their second branch in town. They have a really good collection and quality of Chaat and appetizers. 

Their vegetarian birayani and curry sauce is one of the best in San Francisco. You should also try their chole bhature. It's less oily. Their vada pav is quite good as well.

Their South Indian food is not good at all and their main course is average but their Chaat and appetizers are one of the best in Bay area.
author: Rakesh G.

description: Went here for Valentine's Day, they completely forgot we were sitting there. It took 20 minutes to get a beer, and we just decided to leave after appetizers, because it would take another 30 minutes to order our food. It did take another 20 to get the check though. Went to dinner somewhere else after
author: Meghan H.

description: Really good restaurant for some authentic Indian food; service was decent, but if your looking for traditional Indian food, this is the place to go around the downtown San Francisco....
author: Ankur N.

description: The food & service are reliable. FYI, the deals listed on the sandwich board outside at lunchtime are for carryout only & limited to small portion items. I'm a little spoiled, having lived in 2 places with very large South Asian populations, so maybe I was expecting something else. Seems to cater to a white business crowd for lunch.
author: Scott Z.

description:
This restaurant has less seating but is extremely clean and the staff is very attentive. The food took time to come but what's great about this place is that it's open till 12 midnight.We ordered :

Sev puri: this dish was great and the yogurt tasted fresh! Would have liked some more sev sprinkled on the top.

Aloo papdi: great dish! The potatoes were fresh and the spices just right.

Kheema pav: this was the second best dish that night! This was amazing ! The spices right and the pav has the right amount of butter. If you eat non veg.. this is your dish !

Paneer mutter: this is very different from the other curries you will eat. It is relatively dry but hands down the best dish of the night! 

Paneer makhani: loved the touch of kasuri methi...tasted good. But not as good as paneer mutter! 

Last but not the least... the lamb biryani. This impressed me.. the meat was cooked well with the spices and the rice was soft.

All in all, great place...have to come visit this place again soon whenever I'm the city next!
author: Nayana R.

description: This is only based off customer service. I wish I can give them 0 stars. The staff here is extended rude. The indian lady who helped me was rude. I did not even feel comfortable being in the restaurant. Don't eat here. Go somewhere, where you are treated well as a patron.
author: Jessica S.

description: We found this place to be excellent Indian food and great service! The staff is friendly and welcoming!! We would definitely recommend!
author: Anita P.

description: This place was awesome. I ordered the vindaloo and it was so delicious. I highly recommend this place.
author: Taylor D.

description: Very delicious I recommend this place  for dinner date ! Or friends. Very tasty, I wish they have more dessert and they'll be perfect.
author: Ai K.

description: Below average food quality.  Ordered was brought out incorrectly and waiter was slow in bringing the check.  Would not go again.
author: Tahir C.

description:
Surprised by the 4 star rating this place has.

Came here for some snacks on NYE as I had a friend visiting from out of town and he wanted some chaat before going to see fireworks along the Embarcadero. We yelped chaat spots in the city and Chaat Corner seemed promising based on the location and the rating.

The location is great as it is situated in the heart of downtown SF just mere blocks from Union Square. The restaurant itself is spacious and clean and has a modern feel to it that aligns with its amazing location. 

Everything seemed so promising until we were seated. The restaurant was not very crowded since we got there around 11 pm (they close at midnight), yet it took forever for the server to come and give us our menus and then subsequently take our orders. My friend ordered a beer, which he never got since our server had forgotten to enter it into their system, and by the time we realized it, we decided it wasn't worth the extra wait for the beer since we were halfway done with our food.

My friend and I both weren't too hungry, so we ordered the aloo tikki chaat and a side of the tandoori chicken. I was excited about the chicken, but after one bite I was hard pressed to eat more. It was the driest chicken I've had in a long time (possibly years) and I tried to compensate by cutting it up into many small pieces and dipping it into the more sauce-y aloo tikki chaat to add some more moisture to the meat. I halfheartedly ate two pieces of the chicken and then gave up. I didn't eat much of the aloo tikki chaat, but my friend (who is Indian) did not like it at all either.

All in all, would NOT recommend this place to anyone. Don't be fooled by the nice appearance!
author: Dianna H.

description:
4 stars? How and Why?? I went to this place with a bunch of friends who were craving for Chaat and Indian style wraps. As it was raining cats and dogs on Saturday evening and this was the only place opened nearby, we thought of giving it a try. The place was not crowded we got a table immediately. 
The server started by serving us water and handing us the menu cards. After screening through the menu we ordered 2 plates of Papadi chaat, 2 Chicken Tandoori Wrap and 1 Seekh kabab roll. The server told me it will take time to prepare rolls/wraps, I assumed 30 minutes late but 2 hours for a order of 3 rolls/wraps? 
And that too cold wraps and in installements??? If we are placing the order together we expect to get the food together. Chicken Tandoori wrap was bland, no flavor in the chicken and very dry. Who makes a Tandoori wrap with a omelet in between??? 
After 2 hours of wating we are served a Lamb Seekh wrapped in flat bread. No sauce, no spices nothing !! Papadi Chaat was without papadi and full on potatoes, should be renamed to aloo chaat !!! 
Also, one of my friend ordered masala tea which they forgot to serve and when he reminded them they served cold tea, not properly boiled and no masala !!
author: Simran K.

description:
This restaurant recently opened near my office, and  I decided to give it a try. I ordered the lamb biryani, and enjoyed it very much. Very tasty, generous portion, good quality and fairly lean lamb, and fairly priced.
The service was friendly and attentive, and got the order right (no cilantro).
I look forward to returning soon.
author: Jethro B.

description: This restaurant is around the corner from my apartment and I always passed by it without trying. Just recently I tried it for the first time and wasn't disappointed. The people are friendly and the food is amazing! The lamb tiki masala came with beans, naan and rice. It's a great place to go if you're downtown San Francisco. The happy hour deals are 30% off, which is nice. The environment is laid back and chill. It's a great place to go with friends, have a nice meal and drink. Highly recommended.
author: Lucas M.

description: The Chicken Tikka Masala Roll was sooooo good! Chicken was very tender and my taste buds complimented everything in it. I also got the Mango Lassi, a very flavorful drink.
author: Randy A.

description:
We lived around this place so decided to give it a try! We were promptly seated and the place was casual and clean. We started off with veggie aloo frankie and that was really good. We ordered Paneery Chilly dry as an appetizer and then paneer butter masala, naan, rice and yellow dal. Paneer gravy was good but paneer was really chewy and had a weird texture almost tofu like! We were disappointed with the paneer and the naan. Naan was not soft at all. It was a little burnt and it was hard. Interestingly enough, the dal that appeared on the table was a black dal which wasn't even on the menu. On further inquiry they told us that apparently the chef mixed the black and the yellow dal. Weird! But to our luck the dal tasted amazing!!! We ordered one more yellow dal and that turned out to be good as well. The 3 stars are going to the dal, the frankie and the fact that the place was nice and clean. 

Not sure about parking, we stayed around the corner so we were able to walk here! Wouldn't make the drive for this place honestly.
author: Labdhi P.

description: I had the pakoras to go but was impressed by the friendly staff, who offered water while I waited. The ambiance was exceptional and the decor is clean and tasteful. Quite beautiful, a very pleasant experience. Liked at the menu which offers a wonderful variety at fair prices
author: Joseph C.

description: The floors were sticky. The tables were dirty. And the food was pretty bland. However, the service was good, fast, and it's open late. I wouldn't return again though.
author: Girlie G.

description:
New spot in SF, hope it sticks around!

I would have easily given this place 5 stars, but it just took a while for the food to come, and it was only about 20% occupied. 

I was pretty overwhelmed by the menu coming here. There are so many options for food and drinks..plus did I mention they had a HUGE selection of beers? Food took a while to decide, but the daily specials just made it easier. I opted for the lamb curry & the gf got the chicken tikka plate. Both plates came with rice, naan, (mine w/soup).

My lamb curry was perfectly spicy and I really enjoyed it, however.. my girlfriends chicken tikka was by far my favorite. It came on a sizzling plate w/onions. We recorded a video of the food..it just looked heavenly. Paired with the garlic naan and curry, I didn't care that we weren't having a traditional Thanksgiving dinner.

Seeing as Chaat Corner wasn't even a block from our hotel, I will most definitely be back should I ever be in the Bay Area again.
author: Kevin N.

description: We had samosa chaat and samosas they were awesome! My husband and dad (who grew up in Delhi, India) said they were very authentic! The food is pricey but in this case it was worth it.
author: Meena P.

description: Second time visiting , the food is amazing highly recommended. Great waiters. I had spicy chicken kabobs with garlic naan. And my bf had mixed tandoori grill with shrimp and chicken. A must try.
author: R S.

description: Been there 2 times..there Chan a bathura was good but the biryani was so bunt and tasteless that it felt like chewing raw slightly cooked rice
author: Prashanth G.

description:
5 Stars- the food is delicous and the portions unbelievable. The staff very friendly and polite.
Will come back soon.
author: Ben J.

description: We were mild-level hungry but wanting taste.  We came to the right place!  Fast service, Bollywood videos, and amazing food.  We had the samosa order, veggie wrap, and the amazing gobi naan (cauliflower).  Such taste.  Small bill.  We will be back. Others nearby ordered things we sure want to try sometime!!
author: Michael E.

description:
Great place for a quick bite , friendly folks 
Naan was cold both on the wrap and as a side on the entree hence 4 stars , you expect a fresh naan right out of the clay oven in the Bay area ,that's a no exception rule for Indian food
author: Abhishek G.

description:
Came here, placed a small carryout order, paid for it, waited. Waited. Waited. 20 mins later someone comes up to me "excuse me, are you waiting for an order?"

I wanted to say "no, I'm just waiting for the rapture to happen"

I said "yes, it's been 20 mins"

10 mins later that same person comes up to be again and says "excuse me, what did you order?"

I lost it. Eff You.  You took my money and 30 mins later you ask what did I order? Get lost.
author: Sahil B.

description: I just started enjoying Indian food because of this place. I eat vegan and love how the menu appeals to Vegan diet needs. Everything we have ordered is really delicious! The service is awesome, the place is clean and prices are cheap for downtown SF.
author: Yvette M.

description: My boyfriend and I are locals.  We went to the buffet on April 21, 2018.  The food was good but the lentils were cold.  We stacked our on dishes to the side and no one ever came to pick them up.  It was 3:00pm  we cleared our tab.  The menu had a happy hour advertisement stating up to 30% off on wine, beer, etc. from 3:00pm to 6:00 pm. We asked the server if our wine selection was 30% off, he said yes.  When we got the bill the discount was more like 17%.  When I asked the waitress that brought the bill she just shrugged us off and said it was in the system that way with broken English.  She offered no correction or explanation or to get the manager. Simply nothing.  We will never go again and recommend tourist avoid.  If the staff at a restaurant cannot accurately answer questions or tend to the table properly then management is lacking.
author: William C.

description: We order paneer pakoda, that was the only fine thing. Very bad service, they need to work on their cleanliness, spoons not clean and glasses had some smell. Achari paneer and okra was too oily. Naan was ok, have had better in that area.
author: Bina M.

description:
Right across from the Park 55 I am staying at- it had good reviews and is open late. So after my run down Market St and working up an appetite I grabbed a seat at the bar (alone). An Indian Kingfisher beer on tap and two apps from the good list of Chaats with one naan and I was stuffed. The samosa chaat is flavorful and a neat way to enjoy something you may have had in the routine way many times.
Friendly and quick service. An extensive menu. Open late. Free wifi. Many Indian drinks (lassi) and beers and wines with desserts round out menu. Prices are reasonable for sure. I'd take my family here next time I'm in town
author: Laurence S.

description: It's really good food with reasonable price they started buffet omg it's really really good food and lots of item I just love that place
author: Karuna J.

description: The food was mild with not a lot of spice. As an Indian American, I was hoping for a more authentic experience. In addition, the waiter was not attentive at all. We had to grab nearby waiters the entire time because our waiter never bothered to check on us. Okay place to eat but not my favorite at all. Would not recommend.
author: Gurleen V.

description: I went to this Chaat place with a few friends and loved it. The food was ready within a few minutes and tasted amazing . I would definitely go back.
author: Amrit K.

description: Had the curry shrimp dinner and it was a great portion. The service staff is very hospitable and friendly. Definitely recommend!
author: Daniela C.

description:
Stopped in after looking at the menu in the window- so excited to see so many options!!! The service was exceptional and our waitress was very familiar with the ingredient used, helping me to choose selections free of gluten. We got paneer pakora as appetizer and it was perfect- crispy on the outside and firm cheesy goodness inside, complete with the dusting of chat masala that makes me smile in tastebud happiness.
I got the aloo gobi plate which I was incredibly happy with- the price was great for the portions and the flavours were complex and delicious. He got the chicken korma and was just as pleased as I was.
Do yourself a favor and stop in...you will not be sorry
author: Joy M.

description: Literally love the food and the way of service they give to us. Fluently and nice staff with excellent food ... definitely recommend to go there and I will be back soon to have the panipuri.....
author: Surendra K.

description: We ordered a garlic naan, a chicken biryani, and a chicken tandoori. Nothing short than delicious. Spices everywhere. Fantastic spot
author: Wahjudy S.

description: You got to have the Chicken Tikka Mosala Roll with a Mango Lassi drink. Really delicious!
author: Randy A.

description: Nice place in the city. If you are craving for some chaat or indian while you are in the city this the place. Their tikka masala is great.
author: Laxmi V.

description: The staff is not friendly and and their debit card machine doesn't work they didn't make us feel welcome
author: Yanni W.

description:
Just came from Los Angeles, Needed to get some indian food. Saw chaat corner infront of my hotel. Went there in the evening for chaats. I must say I never had an amazing chaat as this. Tried dahi batata puri and bhel purI. Amazing food and great service. Must go for everyone who loves indian food.
Great work Chaat corner!!!!
author: Uttam S.

description: I went in to get a late night snack to go. I ordered a rose lassi, papadam and caesar salad. The rose lassi was very very sweet, pink, as if they used a few pumps of a rose syrup. I didn't like it that sweet, I'm used to the yogurty tasting lassi with rose water not syrup. Maybe some others would like it that way. The the menu said the caesar salad dressing was minty. There was no mint in the dressing, instead it tasted like chemicals, like a cheap caesar dressing from Jack in the box with the same quality croutons. The papadum were ok. On the positive side, it was a clean, bright, pleasant atmosphere and the server was friendly. To me it was a waste of money, I threw most of it in the trash, and I won't ever order those things again. I may try the chaat one day, which I would expect to be of better quality.
author: Babs P.

description:
Eh. Nothing fabulous. Server was awful. :/
I've definitely had better. Chicken korma was a 6/10 once they got our order right.
author: Victoria H.

description: Nice, laid back place. Recommend coming for lunch as Indian food can be quite heavy. Their Chicken Vindaloo and Dhai Vada are pretty good. What I like most though -- is they give you a "dinner" option, which means you get a bunch of sides with the dish your order. E.g. If you order the dinner version of any main dish -- you can get rice, the vegetable of the day, a naan or roti, and dal -- with a price difference of $5
author: Tanika T.

description:
I always get goat at chaat corner, because goat is the best meat. On our most recent visit I had the Biryani. I ate about 10% of it because their portions are absolutely ridiculous. I will be eating it for the rest of the week, and couldn't be happier.

Restaurant is always clean and servers are attentive.
author: John P.

description:
So regarding the so called "vegan" options:
(Long story short, don't trust that "vegan" lable)

Just went here the other day, I work across the street so I've eaten here a few times now. My first time ordering togo I waited an hour for the food, but they've got better since. Anyway...on the menu they've labled the things that are "vegan" and vegetarian, which is something I get pretty exited about! It lets me know that the restaurant atleast knows what vegan means. 

Since being vegan, I tend to avoid pakora because the batter they are fried in normally contains milk, so I was pleasantly suprised to see the word vegan next to at least 2 of the pakora options. I orderd one of them, and since I was sitting at the bar I was just having casual conversation with one of the workers I mentioned how I was happy there was no dairy in them. He ended up saying something like " Yea wellll they do kinda add milk and maybe butter, is that ok? "
Obviously I said no, and checked out the menu again. 

Then I asked about the somosas that have the vegan lable... same thing, "mmm yea definitely milk in that too". Of course I started questioning why they even put the lable if there is dairy, he said "This is 'Indian' vegan... its different". I tried getting him to enlighten me on the difference, but quickly gave up when it seemed like we no longer understood eachother.

I settled on some potato pancakes things with this casual vegan lable, and based on how I felt after eating then, im sure there was dairy in them too.

Dont trust the labels! 
Id say just stick to the dishes where you can see the ingredients, like the dal or aloo gobi, stear clear of anything batterd or bready in general.
author: Jade H.

description: I wish i could give 0 stars. The food is tooooo oily. The pav bhaji is tasteless. Pav vada is tasteless. It feels like we just drank oil and came back.
author: Rishi R.

description: Good locations with all windows on one side. Nice interior and decent vegetarian options.
author: Rishabh J.

description: This place has a good ambience. If you are looking for a milk tea they have it. But if you are looking for a typical biryani (esp Hyderabadi style) this is not the one to go.
author: Mounika A.

description: Samosachaat mild is also too damn spicy! Sev puri was good. The biryani was a joke to any Hyderabadi , prompt service :)
author: Adwait A.

description: Great service, but the food is just mediocre. Other hole-in-the-wall Pakistani joints are a lot more legit!
author: Vivek N.

description: What's nice surprise.  We fortunately stumbled on this little gem and it was delicious. Yummy food, very clean and great service.
author: Alicia K.

description: Had Pani Puri and Chaat and they were absolutely amazing especially the pani puri water
author: Amin J.

description:
Loved the new location. It's in a great area near work for a quick chaat or chai. 

I had the samosa chaat and a chai. Samosa chaat is HUGE, definitely had too much food. It was also very very delicious. The chai was perfect, strong and rich. Would definitely recommend this place to cure your chaat fix.
author: Akshaya V.

description:
After a long search for Chaat in the bay area. Ordered the dahi batata Chaat which had too much of the sweet chutney. Then the keema pav, too salty. The saving grace was the aloo parantha. 

We decided to try dessert and it was a disaster... Ordered Ras malai and they dressed up a rasagulla as Ras malai by adding the milky sauce to it. When I confronted the wait staff he insisted that it was Ras malai... Smh

Won't be returning to this place anytime soon...
author: Avinash S.

description:
ABSOLUTELY PATHETIC!! I have ordered from this restaurant multiple times in the past and this has been my experience every single time. The reason for my review today is due the the UNBELIEVABLY INCOMPETENT and RUDE staff member who's name is RUSTOM. We placed an order through Uber Eats and only received half the order. When I called the restaurant to ask them about it, I kept getting passed on to different people and finally was told that I will be called back. 

After waiting for 20 mins and not having received any call, I called back and the lady told me that she had told Rustom to call me back. When asked to speak to Rustom, he was EXTREMELY RUDE and told me that he had packed the order correctly and I should call the Uber driver who delivered. After multiple attempts of telling him that I don't have the Uber driver's number and that to solve this issue, to send over the remaining items, he still didn't understand. Eventually the conversation got heated and he hung up! 

Whoever owns this restaurant, your food is just average, your staff are PATHETIC!! I will make sure to let everyone know about this incident.
author: Arjun O.

description: A colleague and I ate here tonight for dinner.  We were early so it was not very busy.  We started off with paneer pakora, something so delicious but missing from so many Indian food restaurant.  I had their Chaat salad with tandoori chicken which was their house salad, it had a good spice and was well made, the chicken was tender and juicy.  For my main course I had the kadhai lamb, it was tender and delicious.   My coworker had the lamb tikka masala, which she enjoyed.  She ordered the dinner and it came with tons of basmati rice, naan, veggies and dal.  It was a great find on our short San Francisco trip!
author: Nicholas P.

description: Clean, great service, they have a bar and I just love the ambiance and the music they play!
author: Yer V.

description: As a native Bombayite and chaat enthusiast, I was very impressed with the taste of the vada pav. The dahi batata puri was awesome too! Their wraps are delicious as well. An all rounds nice place.
author: Dinakar K.

description: I was passing by and was going to another place to eat. I then saw chaat corner and changed my mind to try out this place. And I am happy that I changed my decision. I ordered a cup of chai and chole bhature. Food came in time. Least waiting. Now I take food items one by one: Chai - perfectly made. I have had that kind of tea in my home town and in Punjab! Perfect quantity of chai, tea used, water and milk combo to make the tea. Nailed it! Chole bhature - again, nailed it! Perfect quantity of chickpeas. Perfect combination of spices, perfect size of bhature and least amount of oily. Moreover, I was offered onion and spices (achaar) too. Very good! Restaurant is neat and clean and waitresses are very nice spoken and helpful! Overall, I'm very satisfied and will come back when I visit San Francisco next time! Highly recommend!
author: Vikas T.

description: I had a full dinner (aloo mutter thali) + tap beer for $22. Food was great and very nicely spiced. Service was very quick and friendly.
author: Na N.

description: Really good and authentic. My kids even ate more than they usually do at other indian restaurants
author: Vayshali B.

description:
Not sure who are the folks giving 5+ ratings to this place ! May be Indian food noobs . The taste at this establishment is mediocre and slightly better than ready to eat Indian food . 

I ordered Chana batura - comes with 2 baturas, the top batura was fresh and hot and the bottom one was cold and smelled stale . I asked the lady serving and she says , oh they definitely do microwave before sending to the table, I can check for you .

Really ? Microwave ?? Thank you but buh byee

I don't blame inability to cook flavorful food , but I don't appreciate being cheated
author: Feedback M.

description:
Best place to have Chaat...Mind blowing food, feels like I am eating in India 

Definitely recommend eating here if you are in the City...
author: Manali D.

description: This place was a complete rip off. Went here with my boyfriend, and we both ordered entrees. The entrees came by themselves with nothing on the side, and they were very much so over priced. Then when we asked the worker for one order of naan he said it wasn't enough for two people and lied about the size of the bread to us. We ended up getting two orders, and it was 4 big slices. The workers were extremely shady, and unfriendly. I don't recommend this place.
author: Jenny S.

description:
In short, the food was great, but the service seems lacking.

My wife and I were staying at the Bartlett Bunkhouse, so this place was a block or two walk away.  We went there several times during our week stay and thought the food was excellent, but sometimes the servers came off as tired, apathetic and didn't attend to our drinks or give us refills for the whole meal.  By the third time I had gotten used to it and just ordered an additional drink.  For the price, the food was excellent!
author: Nate D.

description: The food is delicious. Stopped for a quick snack, ordered samosas and they were really good. The service was pretty nice as well.
author: Ashish N.

description: Couldnt have picked a worse restaurant today.  Food was ice cold and raw. When mentioned that food was cold, they microwaved it and got it instead of getting fresh batch. Microwaved fried pakor as were soggy and oily. Had to ask for naan atleast thrice. Bad food, bad service.
author: Minita P.

description: This is our fav go to Indian restaurant in SF if we are craving for North Indian 'street food'. The prices are reasonable and food tastes good. As the name suggest 'Chaat Corner' the place offers delicious snacks. I am not a big fan of their main course. My  husband and I tried their yellow daal and daal makhani - the taste of garlic was way too strong. I would give 5 stars to their egg biryani though and apart from that we particularly like Samosa chat, Chole bhature and mango lassi!
author: Sakshi V.

description: This one of my fav Indian cuisine place in SF. But they cheat a lot of time in quality as well as quantity. I brought a Faluda yesterday it was a take away and I didn't check it there as I had some trust left on them also I was in hurry. And the quantity was almost half the regular. Though, they charged me full amount. Hope Chaat corner will start taking care of their service again. 2 starts ar only for good taste.
author: Parth P.

description: They gave me the food relatively quickly after I came and ordered. The experience was great and the staff was very friendly. I ordered the shrimp curry and it was delicious! My mistake was ordering too much garlic naan :)))
author: Arsentii F.

description: I found this place through Mealpal actually and I'm so glad I did.  I'm a HUGE fan of chaat (think savory Indian street food like dosas and pakora) and this place has the best selection (and it's so delicious!).  Service is good too - one morning I placed a delivery order in advance for a work meeting through Eat 24 for an 11:30 delivery and Eat 24 called me to let me know the restaurant doesn't open until 11 so it might arrive closer to noon.  Since the meeting was at 11:30 that wouldn't work so I canceled the order.  A few minutes later Eat 24 called me back to let me know the restaurant was planning to start making my food prior to when they opened and that they could indeed make it to my office by 11:30.  Food arrived promptly, and everyone at the meeting loved the wrap selection, chutneys, and mini samosas I had ordered.  To top it all off this place is very reasonably priced too.
author: Annalise V.

description: Just picked up a mealpal (chicken tikka masala wrap) and it was delicious! A lot better (and bigger!) than I was expecting given the mealpal photo... that should really be updated!  About the size of a good, hefty burrito, this thing is bursting w flavor and made to order.  It wasn't sitting waiting for pickup like all other mealpal as in the fidi, but I did have to wait for it - I didn't mind the 5-10 minutes, as they offered me a seat at the bar, water, and it came out fresh and hot and ready to go!
author: R L.

description: The staff is very rude. We wanted to sit with our friends and they kept asking us to move somewhere else. Rude staff, not at all friendly and hospitable.
author: Annapoorna B.

description:
This place is open late and not a dive-y spot!  It is open til midnight and the food is great! Really good Indian food, attentive service, and not a quick spot with throw away plates. 
I had the vegetarian Thali (a set menu of small dishes ), and a masala chai. It's a real chai, not a mix (I'm guessing), so comes unsweetened. You add sugar yourself, though I did not feel the need to add any. 
Really clean place, Laid back but efficient service, free wifi, though I didn't use. 
I'll definitely be back, so glad I found!
author: Xenoneon N.

description:
In short: Decent - with a couple good items hampered by disappointing entrees.

Good items:
Paani Poori - yum!
Rose Lassi - also yum!

Okay items:
Desi Chicken Wrap

Bad items:
Butter Chicken 
Chicken Tikka Masala
Tandoori Chicken Legs

The butter chicken and chicken tikka masala had mediocre meat with oversalted gravies.  Overall, didn't get any of the smokiness or flavor that makes curry good.

The tandoori chicken legs were just... Bad. Small portions, overcooked, not-great flavor. 

I really wanted to like this place more. The ambiance is nice and the waiters are friendly and responsive. But if I keep coming back here, I'm going to stick to the chaat and punt on the entrees.
author: Vaibhav M.

description: We were in Union Square and looking for a quick good bite to eat.  Found this place on yelp and was so glad we did.  We ordered the chili chicken dinner and some garlic naans.  The chili chicken was amazing!! We ordered two dinners and an extra naan for  2 adults and 2 kids.  It was more than enough, we were all full.  The restaurant was clean and had a nice feel and very convenient.  I would definitely eat here again.  Also the prices were not bad at all.
author: Gurvir D.

description:
Good ambiance

Other reviews said papri chaat is good though what we were served had little tamarind and yogurt, also it was in bowl which makes no sense, it should be in plate. Try it in vicks, Berkerly to get an idea what is papri chaat

Other item we ordered was  aloo tikki chaat, while chole were tasty, tikki was kinda uncooked...

This place probably does not have standard recipes to prepare stuff, probably thus variance...
author: Prakash H.

description: I'm a self-proclaimed Indian food expert. Not really. I'm just picky. I was craving chaat and samosas so I ordered both to go. They both tasted and looked exactly the same when I opened them up! The samosa was mashed with the chaat. I shared some and was even asked, "what's the difference between the two?" There's a clear difference if made well! The samosas tasted like they were deep fried yesterday and reheated today. Next time I have a chaat craving, I won't be coming back here.
author: A. P.

description: Hands down favorite Indian Restaurant in San Francisco. Fresh food made with fresh ingredients and fresh vegetables. The waiters are all very nice especially the girl with the guitar tattoo on her arm! I'll definitely be back.
author: Michael R.

description: This was the first time I went to San Francisco and I was looking for a nearby restaurant with all I needed recently. I found this nice, elegant restaurant with tasty food and I thank its staff for the good reception
author: Abdulaziz A.

description:
It's hard to find a chaat restaurant in my neck of the woods, so we were excited to try this place out.  

I used google image on my phone to look up the different chaats, b/c the way they were described on the menu were all so similar to me.  Like our friends ordered pani puri but also ordered another dish that really appeared like the same dish, but deconstructed.  Anyways, we ordered most of the chaats, but none really stood out to me.  I think the reason was the overuse of potatoes was not something that I've encountered before.  I think the bhel puri had the least potatoes, and this was the one my friend liked the most.  Our waitress recommended the papri chaat, which had a lot of potatoes, but the yogurt and tamarind chutney more than made up for that in flavor.  The sev puri was memorable b/c it resembled Indian nachos.  We also got the chole bhature, and I thought the bhature (deep fried bread) was delicious, but I've had tastier chole.

The waitstaff was very nice, but there were a couple of times during the service that things went odd.  Like my husband ordered the soda b/c he read there'd be free refills.  When it arrived, he asked if there were free refills and was told that didn't start til later.  Since he didn't want to pay $2 for a can of coke, he declined the soda.  Our waitress seemed concerned and responded, "It is already done."  I didn't think that was right, since she had just handed us the can, and we had not even opened it.  So I insisted, and she called someone over who took the can away.  Later, there was a miscommunication with my friend who ordered more bread, but they had written down cholay bhathure.  Again there was a bit of awkwardness.  I think what happened is that once something is put in the computer system, it can't be removed.  The restaurant made it right for us, but I think a better software system would be helpful.

If you never have had chaat, come here for the experience.  They have one of the widest selections I've seen and in addition, they have all the other usual menu items covered.  They even had lamb and goat and if I recall correctly, fish curries.  This is quite impressive.
