If you're new to Indian food, I think the variety here would be a delicious (and still reasonably priced) introduction.
author: Lan N.

description: I would give this place medium rating. I had their malai kofta and tandoori roti, the roti was hard and the malai kofta tasted a little sour and missed the creaminess in the gravy. For the quality of food, i found the place a bit expensive. Overall not so great food at a high price.
author: Harsha R.

description:
Chaat corner, It really stands for the name, chats here are delicious. Especially the samosa chat.
We ordered kebab and tikka which were really up to the mark. This place is too busy on holidays so make sure you go on a weekday to make the most of it. This place is always going to be on my fav list. All starts yummy
author: Axay P.

description: Mediocre Indian food, at best. This is a place that caters to convention goers, so repeat business is not an issue. Seemed to us that every dish had the same sauce. Much better elsewhere in the area.
author: Lance N.

description: The food is very good. The seatings are very congested.. if you don't mind the ambience then go for it. Try samosa chat..
author: Raf M.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco and was wanting some Indian Food. Found this place on yelp, normally I'd shy away from a place that only had a few reviews but a lot of stars.... glad that I took a chance and tried this out. Ordered the family dinner special, though I wish I knew exactly how much food it included (we had left overs but it's OK bc indian food tastes good as left overs too) everything was flavorful. We ordered Saag Paneer, Butter Chicken (the best!), Samosas, Naan bread, and some vegetable thing that had potatoes and okra. 

100% recommend if you want Indian food and are in the area.
author: Ashley N.

description: The service could not be worst. I literally had to move my dirty plates onto the table that was vacant next to me. I had to ask for water five times just to get some refill. No plates or fork or knives, had to ask for every single thing. Would not recommend to anyone.
author: Hini H.

description: Service is great. Got a basic meal, chicken Tikka masala, very tasty with a little spice, not the usual bland version. Chicken was not over cooked but close which is a pet peeve of mine. Garlic naan was great. But great decore, quiet, and they didn't buy me to leave or anything while I sat and did some work.
author: Dr_Dean G.

description: One of my favorite Indian restuarent in downtown sf.. I tried chicken tikka plate which come in a hot plate .. look amazing and gorgeous...friendly staff and awesome food .. I will be definitely return back to have a great food ..
author: Pramod G.

description: We had an underwhelming experience at Chaat Corner. The food generally lacked in flavor and was served lukewarm. We were especially disappointed in the garlic naan. It seems as though this naan had been microwaved. The texture and flavor were not fresh. Finally, the service was subpar. They were not friendly nor super helpful.
author: Anna W.

description:
We ordered the papri chaat here. The papri was overcooked and stale, and it was relatively bland. The sweet lassi wasn't sweet at all, felt like the same yogurt was used to make the papri chaat. The location is great, the ambiance is pretty good, enjoyed the music and the glass windows overlooking the streets of SF, but the quality of food is meh.

Would not recommend.
author: Asad S.

description: Food was delicious and the portions are great for the price! Highly recommend for authentic Indian cuisine.
author: Shivani J.

description: I really love the chicken tikka masala and the portion sizes are huge!! The menu can be overwhelming there is so much to choose from. Lots of tables, food comes fast. Really friendly staff and great naan!
author: Lindsey R.

description: We came here to dine before our flight to LA. We were hungry so we overdid with our order, which was not the restaurant's fault. The service was quick and courteous. However, the food was more miss than hit. I had salmon tikka masala which I really liked, but nothing else looked appetizing and tasted just OK. The samosas were huge and unexciting, the side veg dishes were really colorless and lumpy. The Indian wine, on the other hand, was surprisingly good and definitely could hold its own against the heavy spices. I wish that more restaurants learn how to strike balance between the portion and the flavor. No one wants to eat a lot of tasteless food and everyone wants a bit more of that scrumptious dish.  Do not compromise, that's all we're asking.
author: Anna D.

description:
The experience was good the first time. Second time it was really bad. 
The team needs to be more professional.

Food is awesome though!
author: Vikas R.

description:
Maybe, it was a bad day for us but I can't agree with everything going wrong at once place. 
Right from start until end everything was bizarre and disappointing. We were told to sit at a table but it was given to someone else and we were still waiting at the door. After getting a table for long time no server attended us, no cutlery no plates. We got small plates for appetizers and told to adjust to it for main-course too which is very disappointing and disrespectful. Butter chicken curry had just and only 3 pieces. And curry itself was one fourth of the bowl and same with the other veg curry we ordered. We ordered veg biryani which they said is not available after 45 MINUTES ! Wow ! I was amazed by this situation and requested for check for which waiter complimented me with rude behavior. I gave one only because there is no zero star or something much more lower rating available. Overall, the service is very disappointing, waiters were literally running all over the place like working out at a gym !! No plan, no restaurant ethics. Food is okay, it is not bad but man..!! Service  is very bad ! And because of all this, we could not make our polish friend happy.
author: Sravan N.

description: Great place to go to! We got the Chaat, Shrimp Pakora, Chicken Kabob Wraps as well and everything was delicious! Service was great and so was the food!! Will come back for more!
author: Karm S.

description: Pakistani restaurant near downtown with good food, nice atmosphere and Kingfisher on tap!  Common food selections well done.
author: Art K.

description: Customer service sucks ... picking up order her for my lunch break ...went to pick my order after 20 mins what I was told me but guess what ..it's not ready ...
author: Kasheel Mavitesh S.

description: Horrible service, the people were so slow but not only that, they were also rude and unhelpful. They also never brought us the extra plate we asked for, there wasn't enough water for the gol gappe, we had to send back the glasses because they had remnants on the inside, and at 2 pm in the afternoon they were already out of dal makhni. Really disappointing because we had enjoyed them the first time.
author: Apara S.

description: We dropped in for chaat on a thursday evening. Nice ambience, close to lots of hotels, etc. Not too crowded. We got seated right away. Staff was friendly. We ordered a keema (minced meat) dish. This was outstanding. The appropriate amount of masala ! Just enough to make you want to sweat.. We loved the food. Will definitely go back there next time we are in the neighborhood.
author: Ravi R.

description: My boyfriend and I came for dinner a night ago and got mini samosas, chicken tikka masala and butter chicken dinners. For drinks I got the mango lassi. The lassi was smooth and our dinner portions were huge and filling. We would definitely come back again.
author: Amy L.

description:
The food is great! However the service is slow and horrible!! They stop checking on you, and don't care! 
They would have got more stars if they had served and treated me better!
author: Verna G.

description: We tried to find New Delhi restaurant and happened on this little jewel. Absolutely delicious chicken Tikka Masala. I think the best I've had in years. Huge portions, great value. Will decently come back on our next trip to San Fran.
author: Maggie V.

description: Quality food reasonable price good location near Powell street varieties of Indian chat visit between 3 to 6 to  get up to 30% discount on chat.
author: Riyaz H.

description: Wandering around, looking for a different Indian restaurant we saw on yelp, we happened into chaat. Tired and hungry we were also pleased with the service (had to wait on my beer tho). The wraps were delicious- Paneer masala and spicy sheekah kabob.
author: Tiffany B.

description: Food was stale and very ordinary. This restaurant  can not sell a single item in native land.
author: Ilango S.

description:
Always good to taste Indian food when your are away from home and enjoy the same taste like how your mom makes.
This place has the taste of how your mom makes at home. Enjoyed each bit of it. Every time we visit is a new adventure and we totally enjoyed it.
Thanks for keeping us happy and filling our tummy ;)
author: Krishna A.

description:
This restaurant would be a strong three-star review were it not for the filthy bathrooms. Remember, the public spaces are usually much cleaner-looking than the staff-only spaces. . 

Food tasted pretty good, but it wasn't especially hot. From order to delivery was less than 4 minutes. That was GREAT, but the food just wasn't hot. Everything was just lukewarm. Food flavor was good, and the quantity was just right. We ordered the dinner specials. 

But the scary part came when I went to the men's room to wash my hands. FILTHY, absolutely filthy. The men's restroom wreaked of urine and warm sewage. The toilet stall was filthy. Toilet paper littered the floor. The toilet paper roll was a yellow piece of string with a roll of paper hanging.
author: scott h.

description:
The most shittiest place to eat..very rude behavior of the staff.. as if they are doing a favor to us by taking our order.. when asked to clean the table.. we got the response from staff that it's clean enough.. Order salty lassi which did not have any salt.. the dahi poori had no taste..again no salt.. I think they ran out of salt..
Samosa chaat was very bad.. the response we got was "since there are so many customers this is what u will get"
Chole bhature was sick..Chole were stale..
Onion paratha was raw and was stinking..
By God never goto to this place..
Not sure how they got license to open a restaurant at such happening place..
This is one place everyone should avoid..
author: Shoaib Q.

description: Price charged was higher than price quoted on menu. When I complained about it, was told that they were not able to change menu cards, prices can only be changed in system. Food was ok, nothing special.
author: Rohan M.

description: All my favorites, including onion bhaji. So many vegan options for my vegan friends. Everything delicious, friendly fast service, reasonable prices and portions. My kind of place, hope to return soon.
author: Shannon R.

description: Clean food. Nice decor.  Good options. Great for kids as food tasty but not spicy.  No parking being downtown.  Not your Desi dive place.
author: Shunaid P.

description: One of the best Indian food around . We ordered Chile bhature, chicken pakora seekh kabab plate. All the items were very close to Delhi food. Highly recommend for North indians specially.
author: Shubham V.

description: We went for a late dinner. The food was good, the lamb tikka was excellent, and the service was good. The ambiance was okay.
author: M A.

description: It is really nice place.. not much expensive.. not far from union square.. kheema pav.. chili pakora and kulfi faluda are the best item I ever had in SF..
author: Saurabh P.

description: What is wrong with Chaat Corner? I've been to the one on 3rd street numerous times, and they have terrible service. This place is no different! While the female staff here are kind, the man that works there is rude. First, they ruin my brother and dads wrap by using day old chicken (I cook- I know what day old chicken is!) and then they said they would replace it which was kind, but then he rudely says you have to pay the extra charge for the Chicken Tikka. Which I'm fine with- we don't need to eat for free, you should pay for what you eat or don't eat at all. But, then he bring us a Chicken Tikka Plate that is $4 extra! And my dad does not need rice or naan with his tikka. He shrugs like a douche and smiles when I say we didn't need the plate. All he had to do was take the plate back! Not the full dish! If you can't accommodate your customers with edible food and choose to be stingy, you don't deserve to be in business! GET YOUR ACT TOGETHER CHAAT CORNER, you make indian people look like assholes because of your mentality!
author: Urmi P.

description:
Pros
Attentive staff 
Fast service 
Clean and nice ambience
I ordered a biryani but was disappointed as it was full of raw onion . Not sure where the chef got this recipe, I have lived in Hyderabad for years ( the Mecca of biryani)The chef should revisit or eat some good hyderabadi biryani . Chaat was good
And for service I give them three stars .
author: Manoj S.

description: Pao Bhaji is served with buns instead of pao's. Pakoras were too oily and soggy. Biryani was sweet, no flavor at all. But I really liked the spicy seekh kabab wrap. They serve Indian Beer on tap.  Quick service.
author: Astha S.

description: Ended up going to this place as adjacent restaurant was closed. Had ordered butter chicken based on dish pic on the menu, taste of which was no where close to authentic butter chicken you get in Bay Area. On top of the tasteless food, the management was poor and disorganised...servers at the restaurant were arguing with each other on the placed orders. Utterly chaotic!
author: Rohit K.

description: Visited this restaurant w/ my family and we had a great time all around. Location is very good, walking distance to Union Square. Ambiance is very nice- nice decor, clean tables, good music. We were seated immediately, and servers were very attentive. Food was very reasonably priced. We tried the sev batata puri (on sweeter side, but extremely good), pav bhaji, chole bhature, and paneer wrap. Pav bhaji and chole bhature were spicy, reminding us of India street food. We asked them to make chole spicier, and they made us a new dish without hesitation. Very good quantity. We would definitely return when in the area again. One feedback is that the video playing in the bar area was an interesting choice- probably meant for adult audiences. You may want to refrain from playing those types of videos in your store-front.
author: Veeral S.

description: Googled Indian places close to Union Square and found this, and headed straight for it on my lunch break. From the pictures it looked super casual but when I arrived I was surprised at how nice it looked! There was a bar in the center, and a staff just waiting to serve. I was worried for a moment that they didn't do takeout, but was delighted when they said they did and it would only take up to ten minutes. The girl at the register poured me a glass of water while I waited. They were all super duper nice, and I just felt welcome as the staff was so friendly! Even when I decided I also wanted a mango lassi after the fact. They brought my order out bagged and ready to go, with the mango lassi inside. When I opened it all up it was well-wrapped with foil as well to protect from spills-including the drink! Excellent service, and great food, I will most definitely be back again!
author: Justine K.

description: My friend and I went here twice and it was pretty good. The food was really spicy! She's a vegan and I'm a vegetarian and there were tons of options. My only complaints are that the mimosas weren't very good and rice doesn't come with the curries.
author: Allie P.

description: Place looks good but food is bad... Chole was all cold (didn't even microwave well... Was nowhere near fresh) Bhature was just like a refried chalupa got from nearest taco bell. All of its stomach got bad just after 30mins... So eat at your own risk...
author: Aditya S.

description: Great service, delicious food and clean facility! Portions were large and prices are inexpensive. All in all a great experience!
author: Caitlin H.

description: My husband had the Chicken Tikka and I had the Vegetarian Plate daily special. Granted we were starving when we came in, and the food was excellent. Spice was great, the staff was very nice and attentive. Always had the water filled before we could go empty. Service was quick.
author: Christine R.

description: Good food and very close to union square. We ordered chicken kebab entree and few chaat favorites and had no regret with the food. Breads were surprisingly soft and good.
author: Manish K.

description: Gotta say, it's been hard to resist going back every day of our week here after the fabulous meal we had.  Both my husband and I had the mixed grill which was fabulous.  We were lucky to have a refrigerator in our hotel room because the portions were so generous.  We will probably return for our final dinner before going back home.
author: Peri G.

description: We were looking for something different and friendly.  Walking along, it's like Indian food, yes! So it was a bit after eight, plenty of staff and great recommendations. Our friends from Australia loved the dishes, and the wine selection met our needs. They have some wines from India, and I must say try one to get the experience.
author: Ed T.

description: Awful service. We asked to sit inside the restaurant a little as it was freezing at the end - the waiter complained, (in Hindi) to another colleague about seating us and clearing a table for us, right in front of us!
author: Pranathi P.

description: I had no idea Chaat opened a location here. I was walking to the Golden Gate Theater to see Cleese & Idle, looking for a place for a quick bite and a beer. There is was, one block from the theater. Beautiful new location, very inviting, same wonderful food
author: Monica H.

description: I love chaat, so I'm biased. Quick and affordable delicious food. Samosa chaat ($8.49), mango lassi, masala chai & paneer pakora. Wish I could remember the prices, but the bill was inexpensive. Service was good.
author: Teresa G.

description: Please open shop in Miami! After a week in SF and eating at several Indian/Pakistani restaurants, I stumbled on Chaat and decided to give it a try. Wonderful, rich flavors. Lamb vindaloo kicks it and the saag goat is perfect - tender and not at all greasy (which happens a lot with goat in the US). Samosa was crisp outside with flavorful filling (not mush but pleasant, textured mixture). Premises is casual enough to walk in but well appointed enough to enjoy a nice date night. And, very friendly service. Eat here.
author: Leanne W.

description: Really nice place for Indian food in a relaxed set up. Food was great, menu had a lot to chose from. Staff is super friendly.
author: Nidhi A.

description: The best Indian restaurant you can find in San Francisco. I have been to various places but this was so far the best spot to have a delicious indian cuisine. Huge menu with great options. All the staff that work here are quite amazing as well.
author: Abhimanyu B.

description: very good simple Indian food. Service was fast and efficient.  Portions were very good as well.
author: Piyush P.

description: Great food, service, and price. Best food i had my entire weekend in SF. Will be back for sure... this place is the real deal.
author: Chris M.

description:
I was at a conference at the hotel across the street, so came here for lunch - I love Indian food, and the veggie biryani was outstanding, good amount of spice, delicious yogurt sauce. Huge menu and attentive and quick service. Yum! 
PS: They've only been open a week which is why there are not more reviews yet.
author: Julie P.

description:
Being an international student from India,my cravings for Indian food was satisfied here.
I ordered Pav bhaji and Baingan Bharta which was just so perfect.
The kulfi faluda at the end was like cherry on the cake.
Thank you chaat corner people.
I might go to this place reg
author: Juhi T.

description:
I have been to chaat corner couple of times with my friends, earlier I was not happy with the food but this time amazed me, I ordered the Samosa chat and chicken biryani with chicken tikka masala. The food seemed really fresh and delicious.
They have improved alot and I hope to come back real soon.
author: Nikki M.

description: Will NEVER go to this restaurant again. NOT RECOMMENDED. One of the worst restaurant experiences i've ever had. I started with roasted Papadum-- perfect, hot, and delicious. Then, the "Cauliflower stuffed Paratha"-- it contained only a few CRUMBS of cauliflower. They said "all our paratha's are like that". I sent it back, and replaced it with "Fish Pakora". The fish was mostly skin and bones, very little meat. And it was inedibly salty, completely salty, tasted coated in salt. I nibbled what little fish-meat i could find, and left a plate full of half-chewed skin and bones. Then tried the "Strawberry Lassi". Delicious. Finally, ordered another roasted Papadum, since i enjoyed it the first time. It was NOT prepared the same way as the papadum i was served 20 minutes earlier-- it was cold and uncooked.
author: johny w.

description: Ordered a pick up for chicken kabab. It was too salty and i threw it away. If I were eating there then I had an option to re-order at least.
author: Arun G.

description: The food was fresh and very flavorful, I'll be coming back with my family soon. I had there Tandoori chicken wrap and it's one of the best I have ever had. Also there samosa was awesome
author: Sean Z.

description: really great service and the food was yummy. they had a family dinner special for $33.99. 2 sides of rice, 2 dishes (we got chicken tikka masala & butter paneer), 4 samosas, a vegetable dish, and a lot of naan. it was a great deal. the food came out so quickly too.
author: Dina K.

description: they serve bread for pav bhaji or vada Pav. Even if bhaji is good giving bread is wrong. This needs to be written. Don't know what other things they have altered .
author: Vijay D.

description: We have been here three times now. Great place to go after the theater. We especially like the chicken biryani and the lamb keema Mattar. Our go to quick delicious SF spot.
author: Linda G.

description: Nice place. Clean good service. Good menu. Only got 3 stars because my dishes were RIDICULOUSLY salty. I don't know if they use MSG or some kind of flavor enhancer or if it's just plain salt but they went WAY overboard. If they cut the sodium by HALF the dishes would probably be perfect. Not sure I'll go back again, which is a bummer because it's a nice place with a good, extensive menu.
author: Frank R.

description: Best food! Clean, reliable, and always excellent service!!! Portions are generous and delicious.
author: Linda R.

description: Amazing food. Decent service. Their Paneer Tikka masala and Malai kofta are to die for. We eat / take-out from here regularly and absolutely love the food. Easily the best / richest North Indian food in the city. We only wish they had more branches!!
author: Raj Thapa T.

description: Great service, clean, romantic music, an amazing family meal special, and we had plenty to walk back to the hotel with. A bit salty, but delicious nevertheless. Very kind, respectful, and attentive staff. Will likely return.
author: Sonia V.

description: On a Christmas night came in gor food. With a party of 12. The place is overcrowded but very patiently the manager attended us. Food was delayed but we understand when they have so many customers demanding for food. They served the good with a dmily gace. Overall, every person  works in this restaurant  is very pleasant and with a tremendous patience! We will definitely come back next time when we r in the city!
author: Vaijayanti B.

description: Real taste of Indian Chaat & food. Atmosphere was very good. Friendly staff & Indian music. Totally awesome!!!
author: Babu S.

description: Oh. My. Goodness. Their curries are so warming and hearty! The food in general is just so so so good...and authentic!! I go at least once a month!
author: Prosenjit K.

description: Great variety of food. Everything we had was very good: saag chaat, lamb, chicken pakora. All were good. Price was very good conferring the quality and quantity.
author: John P.

description: Stay away! Stale food. Nothing here is fresh. There are plenty of authentic, healthy and freshly cooked Indian joints in SF. Their daal had literally been stored for a really long time and tasted outright spoiled :( Paratha and roti tasted bitter which was clear indication that the dough was stale!
author: Nikki P.

description: Food was good but the service and wait time for the food was insane. When you are SFO, you want to get something to eat and get going. We lost almost 2-3 hrs here! For someone who is visiting the place, I don't think the food was worth waiting for that long.
author: Sheelini M.

description: If you haven't tried Chaat corner yet, make sure you do! The food is so addicting - absolutely delicious! The most recommed food is the tandoori salmon, chicken biryani, aloo tikki chaat, pakori chat with mango lassi.. You'll find yourself coming back week after week! & the staff is always super friendly, especially the guy who works the front so that's always a plus!
author: Manoj S.

description: This place is great! Amazing service and spectacular food. My server, juhi, made the whole experience very delightful. She was such a sweetheart. I recommend this place to all. Definitely will be coming back! Love you, juhi! "Tu bohu mitho 'ch hai" lol my newly learned gujarati!
author: Parabh J.

description: Nice food and ambience !! Staff was friendly and service was good! The chaat was really good and also their mint chutney.
author: Ronak S.

description: Went here on our trip to San Francisco from Seattle. This has to be the best place we have eaten at in this City. I've had a little exposure to Indian food in Vancouver BC but it was nothing like this. The only word I can use is delicious!!!!!!not to much spice not bland, just right if your looking for a real treat this is the place. We had the chicken tikka masala that the staff recommended it was  incredibly good. The place was immaculate and the staff very helpful and engaging. I'm just sorry I don't live close enough to eat there every night.
author: Clint L.

description: Had best papdi chaat and tandoori wrap today. Was there with my 3 friends. Everything was just great and at a very good price. Service was so fast we thought food maybe not that good but looks like they have professional chefs in the kitchen. Looking forward for my next trip there. Please maintain your quality and quantity.Very good food.
author: Atul M.

description: I loved the pakori chat and cholay bhature here, also tandoori chicken and chicken biryani was very tasty.  Prices were also very reasonable. I will definately try something else when I come again.
author: Sristy S.

description: Quite honestly, the best chaat that I have had in the Bay Area! Great flavors, fresh ingredients. Could be spicier. The vada and sambhar are also on point! Fresh, crispy, flavorful. Perfect late night Indian munchies spot. I've only ordered delivery, so can't comment on service. Don't confuse this place with a similarly named place on 3rd st. This is far superior!
author: Neha G.

description: This is a good place to go for dinner, especially a late night dinner, table seating is nice, a bit of a wait because they're just getting use to things, so I won't knock them for that, but if you want faster service, I recommend sitting at the bar. The food is good there, the Chicken Tikka Masala is a winner with me, very delicious.
author: michael j.

description: Excellent food and excellent service! Chicken Tikka Masala was superb. Spice was just right and it had a subtle sweet flavor to it. The servers were friendly and informative. I highly recommend Chaat Corner if you want authentic high quality Indian/Pakistani food!!
author: Mari S.

description: Quality food, great prices and very hardworking and friendly staff. Would for sure come back if I'm in the bay.
author: Scott H.

description: If I could give 0 stars I would , I normally don't write reviews but had to write this one . The worst restaurant I have ever been to . Food was horrible , service was horrible, everything was wrong , they just couldn't handle the crowd. In fact the servers themselves were laughing , when we ordered saying we can put in the order but not sure when you will get it !!!!! We had ordered dahi Batata puri, there was no dahi in it , pav bhaji was so spicy(as it was as if made out of chili powder), paneer kebabs were supposed to be served on hot plate but came out cold & uncooked. When we come as a group we expect food to be served together , it took us more than 2 hours with all of us getting our foods at their own pace . Worst of it was no water was served we had to ask couple of times before they bought it. It was not only us , this was the plight on all the tables around us. What is on the menu & what shows up is completely different . Not going back there again !!!
author: Kavitha I.
